schema.description: the data model for execution broker

table.description: Container class for ExecutionSession responses.
Abstract base class for executables.
Details of the container image.

column.description: An array of repository locations. {repository}/{namespace}/{container}:{tag} e.g. ghcr.io/ivoa/oligia-webtop:ubuntu-2022.01.13

Images that use the v2 or later format have a content-addressable identifier called a digest. As long as the input used to generate the image is unchanged, the digest value is predictable. The digest is generated as a sha256 checksum when the image is built. The digest can be used to verify the contents of an image.

Details of the platform the container image is built for. Debatable whether we need to have this here. The information will be in the container, and the platform will probably need to check it anyway to make sure. So why have the duplicate information ?

Details of the platform the container image is built for. Debatable whether we need to have this here. The information will be in the container, and the platform will probably need to check it anyway to make sure. So why have the duplicate information ?

table.description: Details of a network port on the container made available for connection from outside.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:DockerNetworkSpec composition of execbroker:DockerNetworkPort
A flag to indicate whether this port should be listed in the access methods for the execution.
Details of an internal network port on a container.
Details of an external network port accessible from outside.
Details of an external network port accessible from outside.

The network protocol to use, typically one of [UDP, TCP, HTTP, HTTPS], with a default of `TCP`. This should be defined as part of the description of the executable supplied by the client. The `HTTP` and `HTTPS` values further specify the protocol to use on top of `TCP`. Specifying `HTTPS` may help to meet firewall restrictions at some sites.

The path component of an access URL. This should be defined as part of the description of the executable supplied by the client. This can be used to provide the path of a notebook within a JupyterNotebook container.

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:DockerNetworkPort composition in execbroker:DockerNetworkSpec

table.description: Details of the network access available to the container.
Details for a Docker or OCI container executable. See https://opencontainers.org/

column.description: Set the privileged flag on execution. The default is `false`. See https://docs.docker.com/reference/cli/docker/container/run/#privileged.
Overwrite the default ENTRYPOINT of the image.
A map of name->value properties. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/dictionaries/
A map of name->value properties. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/dictionaries/

table.description: Details for a Singularity container executable. See https://docs.sylabs.io/guides/latest/user-guide/

column.description: The URL to download the container image from.

table.description: Details for a Jupyter notebook executable. See https://jupyter.org/

column.description: The URL of the notebook. TODO - This needs to take into account different ways of referring to a notebook.

table.description: A log message based on the Message Templates standard. https://messagetemplates.org/

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:ComponentMetadata composition of execbroker:MessageItem
The message type identifier. Typically a URL pointing to a human readable description of the message.
The date and time of the message.
A map of name->value properties. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/dictionaries/
A map of name->value properties. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/dictionaries/

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:MessageItem composition in execbroker:ComponentMetadata

table.description: Abstract base class for describing options. This includes the `type` discriminator and the target `path` to update.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:ComponentMetadata composition of execbroker:AbstractOption
The path this option applies to.

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:AbstractOption composition in execbroker:ComponentMetadata

table.description: A simple string value option. This option enables the client to set a string value pointed to by the path.

column.description: A regular expression pattern restricting the value.

table.description: A simple enum value option. This option enables the client to set an enum value pointed to by the path.
A simple integer value option. This option enables the client to set an integer value pointed to by the path.

column.description: The minimum value that can be set.
The maximum value that can be set.
The units used for the maximum and minimum values and the default units used for the update. The client may specify different units in the update if they need to.

table.description: A simple integer delta option. This option enables the client to increment or decrement an integer value pointed to by the path.

column.description: The minimum change that can be applied.
The maximum change that can be applied.
The units used for the maximum and minimum values and the default units used for the update. The client may specify different units in the update if they need to.

table.description: A metadata block for our components. This includes a name, a UUID identifier, a URL, and lists of the messages and options.

column.description: A machine readable UUID, assigned when a component is created in a service.
A human readable name, assigned by the client.
The URL to access this component.
The date and time the component was created.
The date and time the component was last modified.

table.description: Abstract base class for all our components.
A component with a lifecycle.
Abstract base class for compute resources.
A simple compute resource.

column.description: The number of CPU cores requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest number of cores that the excution can use.
The number of CPU cores requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest number of cores that the excution can use.

The amount of memory requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest amount of memory that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.

The amount of memory requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest amount of memory that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.
A list of the filesystem volumes to mount.

table.description: Abstract base class for storage resources.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractStorageResource
foreign key column for execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractStorageResource

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:AbstractStorageResource composition in execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents
foreign key for execbroker:AbstractStorageResource composition in execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents

table.description: A simple storage resource.

column.description: The size of storage requested. The minimum represents the minimum size the excution requires. The maximum represents the maximum size that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.

The size of storage requested. The minimum represents the minimum size the excution requires. The maximum represents the maximum size that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.

table.description: Abstract base class for volume mounts.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractVolumeMount
foreign key column for execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractVolumeMount

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:AbstractVolumeMount composition in execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents
foreign key for execbroker:AbstractVolumeMount composition in execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents

table.description: A simple volume mount.

column.description: If cardinality is set to INSTANCE, then this volume-mount will mount a single resource at the location set by path. If cardinality is set to CONTAINER, then this volume-mount will create a directory in the target file system, at the location set by path, and mount the resources within that directory.

A list of the data resources in this volume mount. If cardinality is set to INSTANCE then this list should only contain one resource. If cardinality is set to INSTANCE and this list has more than one resource, it should fail validation. If cardinality is set to CONTAINER then this list may contain more than one resource.

table.description: Abstract base class for data resources.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractDataResource
foreign key column for execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents composition of execbroker:AbstractDataResource

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:AbstractDataResource composition in execbroker:ExecutionRequestComponents
foreign key for execbroker:AbstractDataResource composition in execbroker:SimpleExecutionComponents

table.description: A simple downloadable data resource.

column.description: The URL of the data to import.

table.description: A data resource in a S3 storage system.

column.description: The endpoint address of the S3 service.
The URL template for the S3 service.
The target object name. Leaving this blank will mount the whole bucket as a directory.

table.description: Metadata describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.

column.description: A reusable block describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.
A reusable block describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.
A reusable block describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.
A reusable block describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.

table.description: A row of ObsCore metadata about the resource.
A row of DataLink metadata about the resource.
The IVOA metadata for the resource.
Metadata describing an IVOA data resource.
Metadata about a replica in an RSE.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:SkaoDataResourceBlock composition of execbroker:SkaoReplicaItem
The URL/URI of the object within the RSE.

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:SkaoReplicaItem composition in execbroker:SkaoDataResourceBlock

table.description: A reusable block describing the metadata for a SKAO data resource.

column.description: The DM-API namespace (equivalent to the Rucio scope).

table.description: Metadata describing a SKAO data resource in the data lake.
The combination of an executable and the compute, storage, volumes, and data resources it needs.
The requested schedule.
The requested schedule.
A request for a set of offers for an execution.
Abstract base class for execution sessions.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:OfferSetResponse composition of execbroker:AbstractExecutionSession

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:AbstractExecutionSession composition in execbroker:OfferSetResponse

table.description: The combination of an executable and the compute, storage, volumes, and data resources it needs.
A connector to interact with the session.

column.description: foreign key column for execbroker:SimpleExecutionSession composition of execbroker:SimpleSessionConnector
A URI to identify the type of connector.
A flag to indicate the staus of the access method.
The access protocol, provided by the server when an offer is made. Typically one of [TCP, HTTP, HTTPS].

foreignKey.description: foreign key for execbroker:SimpleSessionConnector composition in execbroker:SimpleExecutionSession

table.description: A simple execution session.

column.description: The date and time when this offer expires. Only valid while the state is OFFERED

table.description: An Execution Session schedule.
A scheduled execution session.
A set of executions offered in response to a request, including a uuid, href, and an expiry date for the set.

column.description: A flag to indicate whether the request can be handled by this service. If service is able to handle the request, then the `result` will be `YES` and the `offers` block should contain one or more offers. If service is not able to handle the request, the `result` will be `NO` and the `messages` block should contain one or more reasons explaining why.

table.description: Abstract base class for updates. This includes the `type` discriminator and the target `path` to update.

column.description: The path this update applies to.

table.description: A simple string value update.
A simple enum value update.
A simple integer value update.

column.description: The units to use for the value.

table.description: A simple integer delta update. This increments or decrements the target value by the specified amount.

column.description: The increment or decrement to apply.
The units to use for the change.
